sentence.Network_en: She dressed flamboyantly so that everyone would remember her.
sentence.Network_cn: 她穿得花里胡哨，这样人人都会对她有印象。

sentence.Network_en: The criticism of Mr Obama's handling of the oil spill has been especially and flamboyantly unreasonable.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于奥巴马对漏油事件的处理,人们的批评尤其夸大得没有道理.

list.abs: one of the most flamboyantly wealthy and ostentatiousin the country ' s history ., 中国历史上最富丽堂皇 , 极尽奢华的朝代之一.
He dresses rather flamboyantly ., 他衣着华丽.
flamboyantly reckless and boastful behavior ., 不计后果的自负的行为.

entry.tran: 引人注目的;炫耀的;时髦的
entry.def: If you say that someone or something is flamboyant, you mean that they are very noticeable, stylish, and exciting.

example.ex: Freddie Mercury was a flamboyant star of the British hard rock scene.
example.tran: 弗雷迪·摩克瑞是英国硬摇滚乐界一颗耀眼的明星。

example.ex: ...his lightning speed and flamboyant, aggressive style of play...
example.tran: 他闪电般的速度以及花哨夸张、咄咄逼人的打球风格

auth_sentence.content: On the whole, too, Christie has assembled a cast capable of doing justice to Charpentier's flamboyantly decorated vocal lines.
auth_sentence.res_content: On the whole, too, Christie has assembled a cast capable of doing justice to Charpentier's flamboyantly decorated vocal lines.

auth_sentence.content: He handed her a CD to play, then walked to the end of the room and tilted his hat flamboyantly, waiting for the music to start.

auth_sentence.content: Her first impression was of a tall figure, rock-star skinny, and flamboyantly strange.
